subject: RE: [junit] JUnit vs Regression Testing
msgSnippet: Hi Anand, this something totally different. Have a look at eXtreme Porgramming und unit testing. The idea is to write unit tests before writing the actual
messageBody:
Hi Anand,

this something totally different. Have a look at eXtreme Porgramming und
unit testing. The idea is to write unit tests before writing the actual
code. This implies that you have defined your results first and implement
your class/interface along this "specification". Although I admit that most
programmers will write there unit tests after coding. Nevertheless is unit
testing always a white box test done by the programmer ensuring that changes
in the code will not break functionality other modules may rely on.

Regression tests are a completly different beast.

Greetings,
Jorg

>-----Original Message-----
>From: anand_73@... [mailto:anand_73@...]
>Sent: Thursday, August 23, 2001 6:27 AM
>To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [junit] JUnit vs Regression Testing
>
>
>Hi
>
>I would like to clarify one thing.
>When a commercial tool is used to test a product,it records the
>results from the first test run and compares it when we run again (
>Regression Testing ).
>
>How do we actually do this with JUnit ?
>
>Thanks
>Anand
>
